verses.roman:
ānande vihvala bhakta-gaṇa dhāñā āilā
narendre āsiyā sabe prabhure mililā

synonyms: ānande—in great pleasure; vihvala—overwhelmed; bhakta-gaṇa—all the devotees; dhāñā āilā—very hastily came; narendre āsiyā—coming to the shore of Narendra Lake; sabe—all of them; prabhure—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mililā—met.
translation: Being overwhelmed with great pleasure, all the devotees hastily went to see the Lord. They met Him on the banks of Narendra-sarovara, the celebrated lake.
